content.raw: were there non-static models in the ogre1 world? I tested ogre1 in an empty world and ran into the same problem

content.raw: Thanks for the fix! If I remember correctly though, when It tried yesterday, `ogre1` was working despite that issue :thinking:
content.html: Thanks for the fix! If I remember correctly though, when It tried yesterday, ogre1 was working despite that issue

content.raw: the problem was due to sim time not updating. It was fixed in pull request #450 but that was targeted at ign-gazebo2. I manually applied the change to this branch in [c46fbaf](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/commits/c46fbaff67baf81015f89b108b65931482bebe90)
content.html: the problem was due to sim time not updating. It was fixed in pull request #450 but that was targeted at ign-gazebo2. I manually applied the change to this branch in c46fbaf

content.raw: Thanks, that fixed the crash for me. Just noticed one other detail which I'm not sure was there before, but the ogre2 marker doesn't seem to die once its lifetime is over for the example. The ogre marker respects the lifetime.
content.html: Thanks, that fixed the crash for me. Just noticed one other detail which I'm not sure was there before, but the ogre2 marker doesn't seem to die once its lifetime is over for the example. The ogre marker respects the lifetime.

content.raw: fixed in [ign-rendering pull request #214](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/214/fix-ogre2-detaching-geometry/diff)
content.html: fixed in ign-rendering pull request #214

content.raw:
I made a couple of changes in 66b3777 so the demo works now that a 0 ID means a unique ID.

@{iche033} , the example is currently crashing for me with ogre2 with this message:

~~~
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'Ogre::ItemIdentityException'                                                          
  what():  OGRE EXCEPTION(5:ItemIdentityException): MovableObject ID: 26, named '__IGN_MARKER_VISUAL__2_scene::Marker(65496)' is not attached to this SceneNode! in SceneNode::d
etachObject at /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/ogre-2.1-debbuilder/repo/OgreMain/src/OgreSceneNode.cpp (line 193)  
~~~

It may be related to the latest changes.
content.html:
I made a couple of changes in 66b3777 so the demo works now that a 0 ID means a unique ID.

@Ian Chen , the example is currently crashing for me with ogre2 with this message:

terminate called after throwing an instance of 'Ogre::ItemIdentityException'                                                          
  what():  OGRE EXCEPTION(5:ItemIdentityException): MovableObject ID: 26, named '__IGN_MARKER_VISUAL__2_scene::Marker(65496)' is not attached to this SceneNode! in SceneNode::d
etachObject at /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/ogre-2.1-debbuilder/repo/OgreMain/src/OgreSceneNode.cpp (line 193)

It may be related to the latest changes.

content.raw: [ign-rendering pull request #209](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/209/support-setting-cast-shadows/diff)
content.html: ign-rendering pull request #209

content.raw:
Oh interesting, I guess the (beginning of the) demo program doesn't cast shadows because the shapes are semi-transparent :thinking: 

I still feel like markers shouldn't cast shadows by default, but I'll leave it up to you peeps.
content.html:
Oh interesting, I guess the (beginning of the) demo program doesn't cast shadows because the shapes are semi-transparent

I still feel like markers shouldn't cast shadows by default, but I'll leave it up to you peeps.

content.raw:
I just did a quick test in gazebo-classic and it seems like simple shape markers do cast shadows in gazebo-classic but lines and points don’t.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/1282225041-markers.jpg)
‌

we can disable shadow casting if we like. That should be quick to do on the ign-rendering side
content.html:
I just did a quick test in gazebo-classic and it seems like simple shape markers do cast shadows in gazebo-classic but lines and points don’t.

‌

we can disable shadow casting if we like. That should be quick to do on the ign-rendering side

content.raw:
I noticed the markers are casting shadows, and I don't think there's a way to disable this through the marker message. On Gazebo-classic, they didn't. I think one would usually expect that a marker doesn't cast shadows. Maybe this is something that needs to be changed in the `ign-rendering` side though.

![shadows_markers.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3252036480-shadows_markers.png)
content.html: I noticed the markers are casting shadows, and I don't think there's a way to disable this through the marker message. On Gazebo-classic, they didn't. I think one would usually expect that a marker doesn't cast shadows. Maybe this is something that needs to be changed in the ign-rendering side though.

content.raw:
This is repeated on line 149, is that intentional? There's no square at this point. And in fact, once the square is added below, these points become all connected, so we should at least clear the message before making the square:

![points_in_square.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3778316847-points_in_square.png)
content.html: This is repeated on line 149, is that intentional? There's no square at this point. And in fact, once the square is added below, these points become all connected, so we should at least clear the message before making the square:

content.raw: ok how about we wait for [one more ign-rendering PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/208/add-ogre2-markers/diff)? Then we can one prerelease to test these new ign-rendering3 features.
content.html: ok how about we wait for one more ign-rendering PR? Then we can one prerelease to test these new ign-rendering3 features.

content.raw: Yes, it would be best not to break homebrew. Can we do a prerelease?
content.html: Yes, it would be best not to break homebrew. Can we do a prerelease?

content.html: the homebrew build is failing as expected - we need to make another ign-rendering3 prerelease. @Louise Poubel do you want to wait until a clean homebrew build before merging this?

content.raw: Do we want to go ahead and merge? @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5}
content.html: Do we want to go ahead and merge? @Ian Chen
